#summary API Specification for Developers


= Boxes Classes =
You can create Pure data boxes using the following objects, each one with some methods:
==Object==
{{{
Object(coord_x, coord_y, label)
}}}
where:
    _coord_x_ = x position of the box;

    _coord_y_ = y position of the box;

    _label_ = defines the kind of the object (eg: "dac~", "osc~ 440");


==Number==
===Constructor===
{{{
Number(coord_x, coord_y)
}}}
where:
    _coord_x_ = x position of the box;

    _coord_y_ = y position of the box;

===Methods===
{{{
move(coord_x, coord_y)
}}}
moves the object in the patch to a new x, y.
where:
    _coord_x_ = x position of the box;

    _coord_y_ = y position of the box;

{{{
move(value)
}}}
sets the number to a specific value;
where:
    _value_ = new value of the number;

{{{
increment()
}}}
increments the value of the number;

{{{
decrement()
}}}
increments the value of the number;



==Message==
{{{
Message(coord_x, coord_y, text)
}}}
where:
    _coord_x_ = x position of the box;

    _coord_y_ = y position of the box;

    _text_ = defines the content of the message;


==Comment==
{{{
Comment(coord_x, coord_y, text)
}}}
where:
    _coord_x_ = x position of the box;

    _coord_y_ = y position of the box;

    _text_ = defines the content of the comment;


==Symbol==
{{{
Symbol(coord_x, coord_y)
}}}
where:
    _coord_x_ = x position of the box;

    _coord_y_ = y position of the box;
